messages.content: What is the format of the final exam?
The final exam is conducted online via the Quizzes tool in CourseLink using Respondus LockDown Browser.
How often should I check CourseLink for updates?
It is recommended to log in to CourseLink daily to check for announcements, access course materials, and review the weekly schedule and assignment requirements.
What should I do if I have issues accessing MyLab?
If you have issues accessing MyLab, you should contact Pearson support or the course instructor for assistance.
What is the policy on late submissions for assignments?
Late assignments are not accepted, but there is flexibility built into the course structure to navigate missed deadlines. Specific policies apply to different types of assignments.
How do I access the required textbook for the course?
The required textbook can be purchased at the Guelph Campus Co-op Bookstore or the University of Guelph Bookstore, and it is available in the Distance Education section.
What is the policy on academic misconduct in this course?
Academic misconduct is not tolerated. Ensure all work submitted is your own and adhere to the University of Guelph’s policy on academic integrity.
What department is this course under?
This course is under the Marketing and Consumer Studies department.
What is the credit weight of this course?
The credit weight of this course is 0.50 credits.
What are the office hours of the instructor?
Office hours are by appointment, available both in person and virtually.
Where can I find course announcements and updates?
Course announcements and updates can be found on CourseLink.
What platform is used for submitting assignments?
Assignments are submitted via MyLab MIS and CourseLink.
Is this course available in an online format?
Yes, this course is available as a distance education (online) course.
Who should I contact for technical issues with CourseLink?
For technical issues with CourseLink, you should contact CourseLink Support at CourseLink@uoguelph.ca or 519-824-4120 ext. 56939.
What is the final exam format?
The final exam will be a mix of multiple-choice and short answer questions.
What is the instructor's background?
The instructor, Nicole McCallum, has a professional background in consulting internationally in commercialization and economic development, and has been teaching at Lang since 2011.
What are the prerequisites for this course?
The prerequisite for this course is MGMT*1000 with 4.00 credits.
What is the course code and title for this class?
The course code is MCS*2020 and the title is 'Information Management.'
When is the final exam for this course?
The final exam is on Monday, August 12, 2024.
How many credits is this course worth?
This course is worth 0.50 credits.
Who is the instructor for this course?
The instructor is Nicole McCallum.
What is the email address of the instructor?
The email address is mccallun@uoguelph.ca.
Where is the instructor's office located?
The instructor's office is located in MINS 257.
What is the required textbook for this course?
The required textbook is 'Management Information Systems: Managing the Digital Firm' by Laudon K. C. and Laudon J. P., 17th Edition, 2021.
What platform is used for course activities and assessments?
MyLab MIS (https://mlm.pearson.com/northamerica/) is used for course activities and assessments.
Where can students find course materials and announcements?
Course materials and announcements can be found on CourseLink (https://CourseLink.uoguelph.ca).
What are some of the topics covered in this course?
Topics include the information economy, information systems and strategy, information ethics, fundamentals of digital marketing, data management, and introductory data analysis.
How many units are there in this course?
There are 12 units in this course.
What is the assessment breakdown for this course?
The assessments include Chapter Simulations (12%), Quizzes (20%), Excel Assignments (25%), Discussions (6%), SONA Research Component (2%), and Final Exam (35%).
What should a student do if they encounter technical issues during the final exam?
They should contact CourseLink Support at CourseLink@uoguelph.ca or 519-824-4120 ext. 56939.
What is the policy on using older editions of the required textbook?
Older editions cannot be used as access to MyLab is needed for assignments.
How can students book an appointment with the instructor?
Students can book an appointment via calendly.com/profnicole.
What materials are needed for the course?
The course requires the textbook 'Management Information Systems: Managing the Digital Firm' and access to MyLab MIS.
Are there any supplementary materials available for the course?
Yes, supplementary materials such as practice questions, summary slides, and flashcards are available on the companion website for Laudon & Laudon book.
How do I access course reserve materials?
Course reserve materials can be accessed through Ares on the CourseLink navbar using your Central Login ID and password.
What is the recommended weekly study schedule for this course?
Each week, allocate approximately 6-8 hours for reviewing lesson materials, reading assignments, completing quizzes/discussions, and working on Excel/Simulation assignments.
What’s the professor's email?
The professor's email is mccallun@uoguelph.ca.
Where can I find the professor's office?
Nicole McCallum's office is located in MINS259.
When are the office hours?
Office hours are by appointment, available both in person and virtually.
Who is the instructor for this course?
The instructor for this course is Nicole McCallum.
What department is this course under?
This course is under the Marketing and Consumer Studies department.
When does the class meet?
Classes are conducted online via Courselink, and it's important to check frequently for updates.
What are the prerequisites for this course?

4.00 credits - Must be completed prior to taking this course. This is a Priority Access Course. Some restrictions may apply during some time periods. Please contact the department for more information. Not available to students registered in BCOMP program.
What should I do if I have questions about course restrictions?
You should check with your advisor for any course restrictions.
What's covered in the first week of class?
In the first week, you'll review the syllabus, assessments, and introduction video on Courselink.
What topics are discussed in Week 3?
Week 3 covers Information Systems, Organizations, and Strategy.
When is the first quiz?
The first quiz opens on October 7 and closes on October 7.
What's the topic for Week 6?
Week 6 covers IT Infrastructure and Emerging Technologies.
When is the final exam?
The final exam date will be available on Webadvisor.
What is the course description?
This course introduces the concepts and principles of information acquisition, manipulation, and management as relevant to organizational decision-making.
What are the main learning outcomes?
Students will discuss trends impacting organizations, explain effective information management for competitive advantage, and evaluate information sources for decision-making.
What kind of assessments are there?
Assessments include quizzes, simulations, Excel assignments, a group project, participation, and a final exam.
What is the primary learning outcome of the simulation assignments?
The primary learning outcome is to understand the importance of managerial decisions and the issues discussed in the course through experiential learning.
How can I improve my performance in simulation assignments?
You can make multiple attempts to improve your decisions based on feedback until you achieve a satisfactory grade.
What should I do if I encounter technical issues with simulation assignments?
If you encounter technical issues, contact the technical support team of MyLab or your course instructor for assistance.
How many simulation assignments are there?
There are five online interactive simulation assignments, one in each part of the course.
What is the purpose of the simulation assignments?
The purpose is to put you in a managerial role to make decisions and understand the importance of issues discussed in the course.
How are simulation assignments graded?
Grading is automated, and you will receive immediate feedback on your work. Your best 4 out of 5 assignments count.
When are simulation assignments due?
Simulation assignments are due in weeks 1, 3, 6, 8, and 10. Refer to the course outline for exact due dates.
What is the total number of online interactive simulation assignments in the course?
There are five online interactive simulation assignments, one in each part of the course.
What is the primary objective of the simulation assignments?
The purpose is to put you in a managerial role to make decisions and understand the importance of issues discussed in the course.
How is the grading process conducted for the simulation assignments?
Grading is automated, and you will receive immediate feedback on your work. Your best 4 out of 5 assignments count.
When are the simulation assignments typically due?
Simulation assignments are due in weeks 1, 3, 6, 8, and 10. Refer to the course outline for exact due dates.
Where can I purchase the access code for MyLab?
You can purchase the access code from your school's bookstore website.
What course should I search for when buying the access code?
Search for MCS 2020 when buying the access code.
How many access codes will I receive?
You will receive two access codes: one for MyLab MIS and one for MyLab IT.
How do I redeem the bookstore redemption code?
Follow the instructions in the email from the bookstore to redeem the code and obtain the MyLab access codes.
What should I do if I don't see the 'Access Pearson' link on CourseLink?
Ask your instructor if you don’t see the 'Access Pearson' link.
What happens after I complete the one-time registration for MyLab?
After completing the one-time registration, future clicks on the links will take you directly to the Pearson site without needing to sign in again.
What should I do if I forgot my Pearson account username or password?
Click on the provided link to recover your username or password.
How do I create a new Pearson account?
Click 'Create' and fill out your personal information, agree to the terms of use, and then click 'Create account.'
Can I use a temporary access code if I am waiting for funds?
Yes, you can use the free 14-day temporary access if you are waiting for funds.
How do I register for MyLab IT course?
Go to the MyLab website via Pearson and follow the same steps as for MyLab MIS.
What is MyLab?
MyLab is an online assessment and learning system that supports various ways of assessment delivery and provides course management capabilities.
What features does MyLab offer to students?
MyLab offers personalized learning experiences, online homework/tutorials, assessments, course resources, study plans, contextual feedback, and a multimedia library.
How can I access my Pearson eText?
You can access your Pearson eText through the provided links in MyLab or the Pearson website.
What should I do if I have browser issues?
Clear your browser cache/cookies and consult the troubleshooting page or the FAQ for help.
How can I get more help if I have problems with MyLab?
Visit the 24/7 support page for chat and text support.
How do I complete a grader activity in MyLab IT?
Download the starting materials, work on the assignments on your computer, upload the completed assignment, and submit it for grading.
What does the Study Plan feature in MyLab provide?
The Study Plan generates personalized exercises based on your homework/test results and provides guided solutions for unlimited practice.
How do I troubleshoot common issues with MyLab?
Clear your browser cache and cookies, and consult the troubleshooting page or FAQ for help. Contact Pearson support if the issue persists.
What is the purpose of the Study Plan feature in MyLab?
The Study Plan feature generates personalized exercises based on your homework/test results and provides guided solutions for unlimited practice.
How do I reset my Pearson account password?
Click on the provided link to recover your username or password and follow the instructions.
Can I use a temporary access code for MyLab?
Yes, you can use a free 14-day temporary access code if you are waiting for funds.
What are the key features of MyLab?
MyLab offers personalized learning experiences, online homework/tutorials, assessments, course resources, study plans, contextual feedback, and a multimedia library.
What is the process for requesting accommodations for disabilities?
Contact Student Accessibility Services as soon as possible to arrange for necessary accommodations.
How are discussion posts graded?
Discussion posts are graded based on completion and quality of participation. Posts must be relevant, thoughtful, and adhere to proper grammar and spelling.
What should I do if I miss a quiz or assignment deadline?
If you miss a deadline, refer to the course policies for possible accommodations and contact your instructor if necessary.
Where can I find additional resources for studying?
Additional resources such as practice questions and summary slides can be found on the companion website for the textbook.
Can I collaborate with classmates on Excel Assignments?
Collaboration is not allowed on Excel Assignments. These are individual tasks designed to assess your personal understanding and skill in applying Excel to solve business problems.
Is it permitted to work with others on Excel Assignments?
No, it is not permitted to work with others on Excel Assignments. Each student must complete the assignments independently to ensure a fair evaluation of their abilities.
Are group efforts allowed for Excel Assignments?
Group efforts are not allowed for Excel Assignments. These assignments are meant to evaluate your individual proficiency with Excel and your ability to analyze data on your own.
Can I discuss Excel Assignments with my classmates?
While you can discuss general concepts with your classmates, you cannot collaborate or share specific solutions for Excel Assignments. Each student must submit their own work.
What is the policy on collaboration for Excel Assignments?
The policy on collaboration for Excel Assignments is strict; all work must be done individually. Sharing answers or working together on these assignments is considered academic misconduct.
What format should I submit my Excel Assignments in?

Submit your Excel Assignments in the required format as specified in the assignment instructions, usually as an .xlsx file. Make sure to follow any specific instructions regarding file naming conventions and data presentation.
How should I format my Excel Assignments for submission?
Format your Excel Assignments as directed in the assignment guidelines, typically in an .xlsx file. Pay attention to any specific instructions related to file names and how to present your data.
In what file type should I submit my Excel Assignments?
Excel Assignments should be submitted as an .xlsx file unless otherwise specified. Be sure to check the assignment details for any particular requirements.
What are the submission requirements for Excel Assignments?

The submission requirements for Excel Assignments generally include saving your work as an .xlsx file and adhering to any given naming conventions and data presentation guidelines mentioned in the instructions.
What format do I need to use for my Excel Assignments?
Use the .xlsx format for your Excel Assignments. Follow any additional formatting and naming instructions provided in the assignment description to ensure proper submission.
What is the purpose of the Excel Assignments?

Excel Assignments are designed to develop your analytical and problem-solving skills by applying Excel tools to business scenarios. Each assignment is based on a unique dataset that you will analyze and report on.
Why are Excel Assignments given?
Excel Assignments are given to help you enhance your ability to use Excel for data analysis and to solve business problems. They aim to build your analytical thinking through practical application.
What goals do Excel Assignments aim to achieve?

The goals of Excel Assignments are to foster your analytical and problem-solving capabilities by requiring you to use Excel tools in real-world business scenarios. This hands-on approach helps you gain practical skills.
Why do we have to complete Excel Assignments?

Completing Excel Assignments allows you to practice and refine your skills in using Excel for business analysis. These assignments are crucial for building your ability to tackle business problems effectively.
What is the objective of the Excel Assignments?

The objective of the Excel Assignments is to develop your proficiency in using Excel for data analysis and problem-solving within business contexts. Each assignment challenges you to work with specific datasets to draw meaningful conclusions.
How are these assignments graded?
Like simulations, grading for Excel Assignments is automated. You will receive feedback immediately and can resubmit your work multiple times to improve your score.
What is the grading process for Excel Assignments?
Excel Assignments are graded automatically. Immediate feedback is provided, and you have the opportunity to resubmit your work multiple times to achieve a better score.
How do I receive my grades for Excel Assignments?
Grades for Excel Assignments are given through an automated system. You will get instant feedback and can make revisions to resubmit your assignment for a higher grade.
Can I improve my grade on Excel Assignments after submitting?
Yes, you can improve your grade on Excel Assignments. The automated grading system allows you to resubmit your work multiple times based on the feedback you receive.
What should I expect in terms of grading for Excel Assignments?
Expect automated grading for Excel Assignments. This system provides quick feedback and the chance to resubmit your work to improve your score as needed.
When are Excel Assignments due?
Assignments are due in Weeks 2, 4, 7, 9, and 11. It's crucial to manage your time effectively to ensure you meet these deadlines.
What are the deadlines for submitting Excel Assignments?
Deadlines for Excel Assignments are scheduled for Weeks 2, 4, 7, 9, and 11. Proper time management is essential to meet these submission dates.
When must I submit my Excel Assignments?
You must submit your Excel Assignments by the deadlines set for Weeks 2, 4, 7, 9, and 11. Adhering to these deadlines is important for timely completion.
What are the submission dates for Excel Assignments?
Submission dates for Excel Assignments fall in Weeks 2, 4, 7, 9, and 11. Ensure you plan your work to meet these critical deadlines.
By when do I need to complete my Excel Assignments?
Excel Assignments need to be completed and submitted by the deadlines in Weeks 2, 4, 7, 9, and 11. Effective time management will help you stay on track.
